page.title:
EIC Project - Status
EIC Project - Status
page.normal_text:
NSAC 2007 Long-Range Plan:
NSAC 2007 Long-Range Plan:

“An Electron-Ion Collider (EIC) with polarized beams has been embraced by the U.S. nuclear science community as embodying the vision for reaching the next QCD frontier. EIC would provide unique capabilities for the study of QCD well beyond those available at existing facilities worldwide and complementary to those planned for the next generation of accelerators in Europe and Asia.”

page.enlisting:
• MEIC/ELIC = a 3-11 GeV on 20-60 GeV ep/eA collider • fully-polarized, longitudinal and transverse • luminosity: about 1034 e-nucleons cm-2 s-1 • Almost all parameters “defendable”? • upgradable to higher energies (250 GeV protons)

page.title:
The “Base EIC”
The “Base EIC”
page.normal_text:
This is my personal and temporal judgment, and may not agree with what a base EIC will turn out to be.
This is my personal and temporal judgment, and may
not agree with what a base EIC will turn out to be.
page.enlisting:
• Range in energy from s = few 100 (COMPASS = 350) to s = few 1000 • Variability in energy without major changes • Ion species up to A = 200 • Both longitudinal and transverse (light) ion polarization, > 70% • Longitudinal electron polarization, > 70% • Preference for (at least) two independent interaction regions • Clear upgradeable path towards higher energy
• Range in energy from s = few 100 (COMPASS = 350) to s = few 1000 • R a n g e

For such a “Base EIC”, the various energy-luminosity profile(s) need to be balanced against the science output, the dollar costs, and the technical viability.

page.title:
(M)EIC@JLab: Plan and Deliverables
(M)EIC@JLab: Plan and Deliverables
page.enlisting:
• Collecting information/references • Performing estimations/calculations if applicable • Formulate a solution/recommendation • Present in ELIC R&D meeting • Write a (minimum) half page on each item for the “design manual” • Accelerator Design “Contract” – Medium energy with scaled down parameters (ELIC version M.1) – “Contract” revision (end of 2010), after user workshops and the • “Design Manual” – A 20 to 30 page document, archived in web – Explanation of high level design choices – Main and secondary parameters, schemes – Major components, and interfaces between them • Action items – Finish in a week per action item(?) – Work scope • Similar Action Item: Detector/IR document • Collecting information/references • Performing estimations/calculations if applicable • Formulate a solution/recommendation • Present in ELIC R&D meeting • Write a (minimum) half page on each item for the “design manual”

page.normal_text:
Or, my own personal Elevator-Talk EIC science goals:
Or, my own personal Elevator-Talk EIC science goals:

Map the spin and 3D quark-gluon structure of protons
Map the spin and 3D quark-gluon structure of protons

(show the nucleon structure picture of the day…) Discover the role of gluons in atomic nuclei
(show the nucleon structure picture of the day…)
Discover the role of gluons in atomic nuclei

(without gluons there are no protons, no neutrons, no atomic nuclei) Understand the creation of the quark-gluon matter around us
(without gluons there are no protons, no neutrons, no atomic nuclei)
